parse

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<MatchResult>> parse(Brush brush,
                                                                          boolean htmlScript,
                                                                          char[] content,
                                                                          int offset,
                                                                          int length)
Parse the content start from offset with length and return the result.

Parameters:
brush - the brush to use
htmlScript - turn HTML-Script on or not
content - the content to parse in char array
offset - the offset
length - the length
Returns:
the parsed result, the key of the map is style key

parse

protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<MatchResult>> parse(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<MatchResult>> matches,
                                                                             Brush brush,
                                                                             boolean htmlScript,
                                                                             char[] content,
                                                                             int offset,
                                                                             int length)
Parse the content start from offset with length with the brush and return the result. All new matches will be added to matches.

Parameters:
matches - the list of matches
brush - the brush to use
htmlScript - turn HTML-Script on or not
content - the content to parse in char array
offset - the offset
length - the length
Returns:
the parsed result, the key of the map is style key

parse

protected void parse(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<MatchResult>> matches,
                     RegExpRule regExpRule,
                     char[] content,
                     int offset,
                     int length)
Parse the content start from offset with length using the regExpRule. All new matches will be added to matches.

Parameters:
matches - the list of matches
regExpRule - the RegExp rule to use
content - the content to parse in char array
offset - the offset
length - the length

getHTMLScriptBrushList

public java.util.List<Brush> getHTMLScriptBrushList()
Get the list of HTML Script brushes.

Returns:
a copy of the list

setHTMLScriptBrushList

public void setHTMLScriptBrushList(java.util.List<Brush> htmlScriptBrushList)
Set HTML Script brushes. Note that this will clear all previous recorded HTML Script brushes.

Parameters:
htmlScriptBrushList - the list that contain the brushes

public void addHTMLScriptBrush(Brush brush)
